name: Ohchicago
body:
### Let's have a good time in Open House Chicago!

## Sunday schedule

```
10:30 am Meet at OTC
11:00 am Get on board on Metra ME. Otherwise we could wait until 12:30 pm.
11:20 am Arrive at 59th, U-Chicago
1:00 pm Visit Robie House, 5757 S Woodlawn Ave
2:00 pm Visit Shrine of Christ the King Sovereign Priest, 6401 S. Woodlawn Ave.
3:00 pm Visit U-chicago campus
4:00 pm Visit KAM Isaiah Israel, 1100 E. Hyde Park Blvd.
6:38 pm Arrive at Metra station.
7:04 pm Get back to Chicago downtown.
```
Have fun!

Notes
***
This Frank Lloyd Wright residence is a masterpiece of the Prairie style and a precursor of modernist architecture. The American Institute of Architects designated the Frederick C. Robie House as one of the 10 most significant structures of the 20th century. It was one of the last buildings to be designed in Wright's Oak Park Studio. Wright used all the technological advancements of the time for his client Frederick C. Robie, a businessman. With its bold horizontal lines, daring cantilevers, stretches of art-glass windows and open floor plan, the homeâ€™s influence on architectural modernism is undisputed.
***
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
